title: BasisCenter
description:
Data for a single atom/center in a basis set.


Parameters
----------
electron_shells : :class:`ElectronShell`
    Electronic shells for this center.
ecp_electrons : int, Default: 0
    Number of electrons replace by ECP potentials.
ecp_potentials : :class:`ECPPotential`, Optional
    ECPs for this center.

ecp_electrons.title: Ecp Electrons
ecp_electrons.description: Number of electrons replace by ECP potentials.

ElectronShell.title: ElectronShell
ElectronShell.description:
Information for a single electronic shell


Parameters
----------
angular_momentum : List[int]
    Angular momentum for this shell.
harmonic_type : {spherical,cartesian}

        The angular momentum representation of a shell.
    
exponents : List[float]
    Exponents for this contracted shell.
coefficients : List[List[float]]
    General contraction coefficients for this shell, individual list components will be the individual segment contraction coefficients.

harmonic_type.title: Harmonic Type
harmonic_type.description: The angular momentum representation of a shell.

coefficients.title: Coefficients
coefficients.description: General contraction coefficients for this shell, individual list components will be the individual segment contraction coefficients.

ECPPotential.title: ECPPotential
ECPPotential.description:
Information for a single ECP potential.


Parameters
----------
ecp_type : {scalar,spinorbit}

        The type of the ECP potential.
    
angular_momentum : List[int]
    Angular momentum for the ECPs.
r_exponents : List[int]
    Exponents of the 'r' term.
gaussian_exponents : List[float]
    Exponents of the 'gaussian' term.
coefficients : List[List[float]]
    General contraction coefficients for this shell, individual list components will be the individual segment contraction coefficients.

ecp_type.title: Ecp Type
ecp_type.description: The type of the ECP potential.

coefficients.title: Coefficients
coefficients.description: General contraction coefficients for this shell, individual list components will be the individual segment contraction coefficients.
